DOC.brief_title: A Study Comparing Safety Efficacy Levofloxacin Metronidazole Versus Piperacillin/Tazobactam Treating Complicated Appendicitis
DOC.detailed_description: Appendicitis may classify uncomplicated ( appendix rupture ) complicate ( appendix rupture gangrene begin ) . Typically patient complicate appendicitis treat intravenous ( IV , vein ) antibiotic therapy . This multicenter , open-label , randomized study patient complicate appendicitis . Prior surgery , patient randomize either levofloxacin/metronidazole IV group ( give daily ) piperacillin/tazobactam IV group ( give 4 time daily ) start study drug . Patients confirm surgery complicate appendicitis , continue receive study drug complete total 4-14 day therapy . Those find uncomplicated appendicitis stop take study drug discontinue study . Patients may switch 48 hour oral therapy , doctor 's discretion . Patients randomized levofloxacin/metronidazole switch oral levofloxacin/metronidazole give daily . Patients randomize piperacillin/tazobactam switched oral amoxicillin/clavulanate acid give twice daily . While hospital , daily assessment make patient clinical sign symptom post-operative wound infection . In addition , temperature , vital sign , pertinent physical finding , white blood count ( normal ) , test infection assess daily hospital . Wound assessment laboratory test perform last visit outpatient . The main objective study determine safety effectiveness regimen contain levofloxacin metronidazole compare regimen piperacillin/tazobactam treatment complicate appendicitis .
